title: Can we do something for Enchantment: Warrior?
body:
Look at the other Jungle items:
{{item:1402}} Gives you a mini Ludens
{{item:1401}} Gives you a mini Sunfire
{{item:1403}} {{item:3930}} Allows you to become cancer incarnate

All Warrior gives is flat stats, no other unique Passive like the rest
Maybe we can lower the AD by 10 and give it http://puu.sh/nuLka/ff2ac23175.png 's old passive which was a true damage DoT?
As it stands it's just a boring stat stick with nothing else going for it

Edit: I completely forgot about {{item:3715}} being a thing
So bringing back Elder Lizard's passive would probably break that item combination
Something else would still be great though

replies.body: It's balanced right now, let's not try to fix something that isn't broken.
The problem is that it isn't fun or unique. If it didn't build out of items a jungler would have anyway, I think people would skip it for Duskblade, Death's Dance, Hydra, etc.

> [{quoted}](name=Ron Pitts,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JYAuVK8l,comment-id=00020002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-04T23:24:28.965+0000)
>
> And what of Magus and the old tank enchant? They were perfectly servicable but were replaced with more interesting items. Warrior is now the only enchant that is purely a stat stick.

I honestly don't remember what Magus did, wasn't it just AP?

I know what was wrong with juggernaut though, it was an hp multiplier when the defensive mastery tree already had some other defensive multipliers and tanks were ALREADY lategame focused champions because of their important role in team fights. It was warping their power curve beyond reason by doing nothing to help with their poor jungle clears, adding nothing to their ganks that they NEEDED to pull off to catch up in gold, and then when they hit those team fights they became literally unkillable because the old tank enchant had to have a massive multiplier to make up for how awful tanks were at the time from every other angle.
Magus was literally Morellonomicon without the Mana Regen. 80 AP. 20% CDR.

> [{quoted}](name=My Waifu Chocola,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JYAuVK8l,comment-id=0002000200000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-04T23:52:41.017+0000)
>
> Magus was literally Morellonomicon without the Mana Regen. 80 AP. 20% CDR.

So like Warrior, except for a class of champions that don't have powerful auto attacks to fall back on when their abilities are on cooldown.

I'm pretty sure that's the main reason most mage items tend to be AP + something cool and useful while most AD caster items are just stats.

I normally agree with Yoshi, but warrior works fine and in most cases, it's not flashy, but very effective.

I know people don't agree, but Devourer is a very delayed power spike in a meta that tends to have quicker games.  I'd rather have a warrior ganking more often pre-20 rather than someone owning team fights post 30 mins.

Then prepare for disappointment because your abilities being up 10% more often is massive and cdr blues have been eclipsing MR this season.

CDR is a good stat. But its not the best stat in the game. There is alot of champions that cdr is good on, however there are some champions that cdr is a garbage stat on as well. {{champion:55}} (hopefully you figure this one out) {{champion:51}} (along with the vast majority of auto attack dependant adcs) {{champion:63}} (because his purpose is basically throw out your spells and get blown up) {{champion:28}} (her cds are so low that you would never need cdr) theres plenty of others, but these are just the ones i saw in the inital 3 rows on the champion icon other than Kat. Saying a stat is "the best" is so arbritary i dont even know why youd say that. Not every champ can utilize CDR, nor AP, Nor AD etc etc. Frankly, the best stats in the game are likely resistances or health as literally everyone can benefit from them. Just dont say such ambigous things like that and expect to get a legitimate response.

this... this... yes 100% yes

there isnt...there cant be, "one stat to rule them all" its illogical, but if there were to be "one stat" it would be health im sure (as armor and MR are 2 stats)

but yeah, WW1337 is right, its definatly not CDR, if you throw your Q every 9 seconds but it does 90% or less of the damage your Q could do with it being on only a 1 second higher cooldown its not any better, not to mention it still has the same resource cost (mana hp w/e)  and recovery rate meaning you would have to use MORE mana, MORE CDs (more time) to have the same effect as someone who didnt prioritize CDR
It's balanced but it's really lame when compared to the other 3.
Let's give it a weaker cresent active, like {{item:3074}}.

Can we just leave it alone?

The champions building it scale best with flat stats, they aren't like mages and tanks that need some niche on the item to help them clear, Fighters don't suffer from those problems.

Which is why most of the lowest winrate junglers build Warrior, right?
(Vi, Kha, Rek, Lee, J4, Heca, Olaf, Rengar, Wukong, Pantheon,  and Trynda)
Winrates be damned, all of those are the type of champion that go apeshit when the smallest buffs go there way, Warrior is just fine.

winrates are only indicators

lets not forget that just because YOU did something that worked very well doesnt mean that the next guy will win 100% of the time just cuz he used X build

ive won games with "troll builds/champs" and lost games with "meta builds/champs"
Winrates are a fraction of a story that don't do anything worthwhile except make some people on the boards think they have a clue about balance.
It's absurdly gold efficient atm so if it was given a passive it would **have** to be reworked entirely so to not break it.
